page.title: 16HEALTH- NORTHLEACH HOSPITAL
page.content: Northleach hospital was originally a workhouse built in 1834. In 1948, it was converted to a cottage hospital, reducing the beds to thirty-eight, divided into 5 wards; each was named after a Cotswold river. The hospital is now a G.P unit, taking local patients, with daily visits from local practicioners. They care for a variety of patients, mostly elderly, but also the terminally and acutely ill. They are looked after by various staff, from opticians and dieticians to a hairdresser. The staff run a yearly fete in Northleach, organised by the hospital, and take part in church services held in Northleach Church. It is obviously important for the hospital to be involved in town life.
